result.execSummary:
The defendant Leonel M Engstrom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant to submit a DNA sample if not already done. Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES. If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION TO BE DETERMINED BY THE DEPT., but to include:
- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessar by the department.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Random urine screens. No positive results.
- No illegal drugs.
- No controlled substances without valid prescription.
- No Contact with drug community.
- Seek/maintain full-time employment.
- Obtain high school diploma or GED.
- Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leonel M Engstrom

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Leonel M Engstrom not in court.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DEFENDANT IS DECEASED.
ANY FINE/FORFEITURES, COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES TO BE WAIVED.
ANY OUTSTANDING CIVIL JUDGMENTS, FINE & COST COMMITMENTS, SUSPENSIONS FOR DRIVING PRIVILEGES TO BE VACATED AND/OR WITHDRAWN.
Proof of death notification received from DOC

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Leonel M Engstrom in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Leonel M Engstrom in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior for Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 36 months, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 18 months with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 months.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.

- Defendant does not qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Appeal rights given.

Defendant Leonel M Engstrom in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Leonel M Engstrom in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Leonel M Engstrom in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Leonel M Engstrom in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel Michael Chernin will be filing a Substitution of Attorney and is now counsel for defendant.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.

Defendant Leonel M Engstrom in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Leonel M Engstrom in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Leonel M Engstrom
Current: 2348 South 33rd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53215   (Effective: 06-04-2015)
Prior: 2438 South 33rd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53215
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
